title.narrative: 6.5 COMMUNITY-BASED CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: Output 6.5: By 2018, children and adolescents are protected by their communities, through the adoption of practices conducive to their well-being, in particular the abandonment of child marriage and the capacity of girls and boys to claim and exercise their rights is strengthened, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6: By 2018, children and adolescents, particularly the most vulnerable, are better protected against abuse, violence and exploitation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.5: By 2018, children and adolescents are protected by their communities, through the adoption of practices conducive totheir well-being, in particular the abandonment of child marriage; and the capacity of girls and boys to claim and exercise theirrights is strengthened

description.narrative: Considerable progress has been made in strengthening the community-based approach to tackle harmful practices mainly child marriage and FGM with further engagement of the government. The program benefited to more than 40,000 children with 22,000 girls. 198 additional villages joined the activities out of 220 villages targeted in 2018 | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of target municipalities that have set up a child protection committee.
Percentage of target municipalities that have included and disbursed a specific budget line for child protection in their Municipal Development Plan.
Number of adolescent girls and women benefitting from asset-building interventions
Percentage of target villages that have completed the learning cycle that publicly declare the abandonment of child marriage and other practices harmful to the well-being of children.
Number of people who participate in social and behavior change communication interventions promoting elimination of VAC through UNICEF programmes
Percentage of target villages that have put in place a child protection committee, elaborated a plan of action and implemented community initiatives.
Country implementing a costed national action plan or strategy to end child marriage.
Number of cases of children in situations of vulnerability taken care of by child protection committees (disaggregated by age, sex, problem and response).
